Summary I bring 26 years of strategic and facility operational management achievements in providing leadership and proven results in the various positions in Facility Operations Management, Real Estate; and Business Operations responsibilities spreading from the USA to Latin America, and Canada. I have managed facility operations, real estate and lease negotiation/administration at various capacities across the America’s for office buildings; complex critical semiconductor manufacturing facilities, data centers, repair shops, warehouses and distributions centers. Under my direction and leadership I developed and improved every organization while delivering precise results. Most recent noteworthy accomplishments at VeriFone; has been designing, constructing and consolidating the Companies SJC Headquarters and establishing global Workplace Guidelines. At IBS I partner with CEO & Sr. VP’s to develop and establish the company’s vision, mission, strategic objectives, product roadmap, and implementation of various business processes & employee development. At Intel I grew the largest Intel Corporate Air Shuttle and managed some of the most complex facilities operations. Key strengths are leadership, innovation, embrace change, think out of the box, program and project management, contract and logistics management and possess the ability to balance the tradeoffs between operation risk and investment while seeking highest quality and best value. Each successive position brought new challenges and increased levels of responsibilities and diversified my skills. Experience Position – Sr. Facilities Director for North & South AMR Verifone March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Rocklin, California Responsible for managing the day to day and strategic real estate facilities portfolio for the America’s which includes 48 facilities and services in Canada, USA, and Latin America. It covers 1,968 employees and 712,000 square feet of leased facilities. Management of the Real Estate Portfolio which included lease negotiations, financial analysis, administration, programming, project management, execution, getting the facilities ready for occupancy. Also in charge of relocating the employees, operations and properly surrendering the old facility in order to provide the office environment required for each unique situation. Other responsibilities include managing employees, budget, decision making, establishing processes, and providing leadership and guidance to the executive management team on strategic management of our real estate portfolio. Partnership and collaboration with all facility suppliers while driving customer value. Key deliverables have been the design and development of the SJC Company Headquarters for 80k square feet for about 400 +employees and delivering Global Corporate Workplace Guidelines which included establishing standards for furniture, architectural finishes; Audio Video; Security Systems. Complete Real Estate Portfolio management for the America’s including negotiations in Spanish. Senior Director of Operations Integrated Building Solutions March 2013  –  February 2014  (1 year) Provided leadership and oversight of the Company Operations. Partnered with CEO and Sr. VP to establish the company’s vision, mission and strategic objectives, policies and practices. Kept organization on track to reach their KPI’s through planning, directing and coordinating activities regarding everything from policies to people. Led the development of the product roadmap, planning, execution, and streamlining the operations, which also included an initiative toward operational excellence (Services). Drove efficiency improvements on the operational systems, processes and policies in support of the organizations mission specifically development better management reporting, information flow management, business processes and organizational planning. Increased the effectiveness and efficiency of company (engineering, software developer, project management and services) through improvements to each function as well as coordination and communication between support, business functions and customers. Developed a lean and efficient org structure and human serviced activities. Direct supervision and management of daily operations and ~20 employees. Aviation Director Intel Corporation June 2009  –  November 2012  (3 years 6 months) Folsom CA 95630 Responsible for daily management and strategic direction for the aviation program. The program enabled business by linking five sites (AZ, FM, SC, OR and WA) with safe, secure, reliable and cost-effective services. . Inclusive of flight operations, maintenance, airport facilities, ground transportation and customer service. Transitioned the program to be the largest, most efficient and cost effective corporate air shuttle service in the US. It offered 142 flights a week with 6 Embraer ERJ’s and a Beechcraft 1900 airplanes. Delivered best aircraft uptime 99.3%; 215,237 productivity hours saved; load factor 89%; obtained 94.1% on-time arrival; customer satisfaction survey rating program the best service 98.4%. Managed Intel employees and ~110 contractors while managing a budget of ~$48 Million. Partnered with purchasing/Legal and negotiated with Embraer to acquire 6 new 145 XR’s (50 seat planes) to be delivered in 2012/2013. Arizona and Latin America Operations Site Manager Intel Corporation January 2008  –  June 2009  (1 year 6 months) Arizona USA; LAR (Brazil, Buenos Aires, Cordova, Guadalajara, Mex City & others Responsible for all strategic and day to day facility services for Arizona and Latin America (Buenos Aires, Cordova, Guadalajara, Mexico City, Brazil and other small sales offices) these included servicing ~8000 employees; ~ 2.7M square feet of space. Services included all facilities operations (engineering, electrical, mechanical, controls, fire & security systems, space planning, food services, landscaping and janitorial) projects, and environmental health and safety compliance. This included an operational budget of $52M dollars and direct management of 28 Intel employees and 210 contractors. California Facilities Operations Manager Intel Corporation April 2002  –  January 2008  (5 years 10 months) Santa Clara and Folsom California Responsible for managing a safe and cost effective operation inclusive of all services (food services, landscaping, janitorial and engineering). Maintaining all utilities including power, high purity water, chemicals, gas & environment controls and security systems. Included critical operations for manufacturing and high performance data centers. Worked closely with the local agencies (Fire Department, OSHA and others) in order to meet safety, environmental and code compliance. Property management of over 100 acres and servicing ~14,000+ employees in Folsom and Santa Clara. Directly managed 7 supervisors and ~98 employees with an operational budget of ~$56M. Regional Strategic Business Manager Intel Corporation January 2001  –  April 2002  (1 year 4 months) Albuquerque, New Mexico and Santa Clara California Responsible for all strategic and tactical business programs, training, leadership development (pipeline & succession, technical development), standardization, benchmarking, organizational health survey and safety self-assessment programs.
